repnme.cdata!:
Europe and Central Asia Region - South East
            Europe Regional  Energy Market Program Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The South East Europe Regional Energy
            Market (SEEREM) Project, supports the countries of South
            East Europe, and Kosovo, in the implementation of their
            electric power sector commitments, under the Athens process.
            The Bank's standard environmental requirements will
            apply to projects supported under this Adaptable Program
            Loan (APL) program. An environmental management plan
            acceptable to the Bank would have to be finalized, and
            disclosed in the country, prior to project appraisal of
            category B projects. More comprehensive environmental impact
            assessments would be required for category A projects. While
            most projects to be financed under the program, are expected
            to be category B projects, some generation renovation
            projects however, might receive category A ratings. This
            environmental management plan addresses in particular, the
            potential environmental adversity due to the equipment
            refurbishment of Lotru - Ciunget HPS, and offers mitigation
            measures as follows. To prevent and avoid oil and lubricant
            spills, used oils will be temporarily stored in buffer
            tanks, to be then loaded into tank trucks, and transported
            by authorized companies who will be responsible for its
            collection, removal and/or eventual regeneration; reusable
            wastes resulting from equipment removal, i.e., ferrous
            metallic, non-ferrous metallic, ceramic materials, shall be
            sorted, and temporarily stored on the power station
            platform, to be then transported by authorized companies
            responsible for its collection, recycling, and/or re-uses;
            equipment containing compounds, i.e., PCBs - polychlorinated
            biphenyls - will be removed in compliance with legal and
            regulatory frameworks, to be stored at approved, selected
            sites; to minimize noise disturbances, a maximum number of
            equipment operating simultaneously will be established, so
            as not to exceed acceptable noise levels, and, new equipment
            to be procured, should be consistent in diminished noise
            generation. In addition, scheduled working hours should
            observe general norms of labor protection related to noise
            levels; the absence of anticorrosive protection materials in
            water systems, calls for the modernization of sealing
            systems, featuring biodegradable absorbing instruments and
            materials, such as absorbent pads, rolls, or anticorrosive
            solvents, primers, and paints, in accordance with
            international standards; soil erosion and contamination
            shall be minimized through careful handling of lubricants
            and oils, avoiding discharges, or pumping, taking special
            consideration to the replacement, and decontamination of
            drainage sands to prevent oil leakages; fire prevention and
            control measures will be in place, and, extinguishers
            (including portable ones) will be required, as will adequate
            staff training, and evacuation procedures, as needed;
            monitoring criteria, and regular inspections will be in
            place to ensure compliance with environmental regulations.

repnme.cdata!:
Romania - Energy Community of South East
            Europe Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
A strategy paper for energy trade in
            South East Europe outlines the Bank's vision for
            regional energy market development, and defines its role in
            supporting the evolution of regional energy trade. The
            framework elaborates the Bank's role in supporting
            policy reform, institutional development, and lending for
            power generation, transmission, distribution. Within this
            framework, the Regional Energy Community of South East
            Europe Program will: a) Create a stable regulatory and
            market framework to attract investments to the region in
            gas, and power network systems; b) ensure the integration of
            regional markets in South East Europe; c) enhance the energy
            security of supply to South East Europe and the European
            Union, providing incentives to connect the Balkans to
            Caspian, and North African gas reserves; and, d) improve the
            environmental situation in relation to energy in the region.
            Under the Program, this project will finance the
            rehabilitation of the Lotru station, having
            Romania/Hidroelectrica been awarded the main rehabilitation
            contract for the Lotru Hydro Project in the country.
            Romania's transmission system operator (TSO)
            Transelectrica, uses the ancillary services made available
            by Hidroelectrica from its Lotru station, operating with a
            regional approach in power system operations. Romania's
            market operator - OPCOM - operates a functioning electricity
            market, with an increasingly regional approach.
            Hidroelectrica will monitor and evaluate project
            implementation on a regular basis, including achievement of
            the objectives, and should submit quarterly progress
            reports. The project however, triggers operational
            safeguards, both on the environment, and on international
            waterways aspects. Project design and environmental
            safeguards will be ensured through project implementation,
            while concerning issues on international waterways the
            project is on the Lotru River, which flows into the Olt
            River, in turn into the Danube on the border between Romania
            and Bulgaria, before reaching the Black Sea. Nonetheless, an
            exemption has been granted, because the Lotru Project does
            not involve works and activities that would exceed the
            original scheme, change its nature, or alter and expand its
            scope and extent, to make it appear a new or different scheme.
